intro: Astragalus golmunensis var. paucipilus, commonly known as the Golmün Astragalus, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. It has a taproot system that allows it to survive in nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
